#summary How to install and connect to SBU Alliance Network
#labels SBU,SBUAlliance,Setup

<h1>Introduction</h1>
<blockquote>
Alliance takes the best from BitTorrent, DirectConnect and Waste and creates a decentralized and secure P2P network. It is a private and secure environment to share files and communicate with people you know. Alliance works on Windows, Linux and Mac. 
</blockquote>
<blockquote>
<b>Questions can be asked below or directly to Spiderman through Reddit: <a href = "http://www.reddit.com/message/compose/?to=Spiderman_&subject=SBUAlliance%20Issue">here</a></b>
</blockquote>
<h1>Connecting</h1>
<blockquote>
<font color="red" size="3"><b>Currently the only way to connect is by hardwiring onto the LAN through ethernet. We're trying to solve this issue as quickly as possible, check back for updates.</b></font>
</blockquote>

<b>First download the program: </b><a href="http://alliance-p2p.googlecode.com/files/AllianceP2P.dmg">Mac</a> or 
<a href="http://alliance-p2p.googlecode.com/files/Alliance%201.3.0.msi">Windows</a> or 
<a href="http://alliance-p2p.googlecode.com/files/AllianceP2P.zip">Linux</a>
<ol>
<li>Once installed, run the program.</li>
  <font color="red"><dd>- Mountain Lion Users (Mac OSX 10.8+) <b>must</b> read the <a href="http://alliance-p2p.googlecode.com/files/OSX%20-%20README%201.3.0.rtf">README</a> file to load Alliance</dd></font>
  <dd>- Windows users who receive the error “unable to access jarfile alliance.tmp”</dd>
  <dd>- Navigate to: C:\Program Files\Alliance</dd> 
  <dd>- Right click Alliance and run as administrator</dd>
<li>Once the program loads you’ll be presented with this screen:</li>
<dd>Enter a username</dd>
  <img src="http://imgur.com/KczFD.png" alt="Screenshot">
  
<li>Then click the “Transfers” tab, you’ll be brought to this screen:</li>

<dd>- Here select a download folder.</dd>
  <img src="http://imgur.com/bGJ55.png" alt="Screenshot">
  
<li>Then from the "Tools" menu select “Shares":</li>
  <img src="http://imgur.com/KJ9Ue.png" alt="Screenshot">

<li>This window will Pop-up where you should select files to share:</li>
  <img src="http://imgur.com/5v8Yu.png" alt="Screenshot">

<li>If you're using an external drive, set it by right clicking:</li>
  <img src="http://imgur.com/AeRzx.png" alt="Screenshot">

<li>Click "ADD FRIENDS" in the top toolbar:</li>
  <img src="http://imgur.com/zTQ7s.png" alt="Screenshot">

<li> When the window pops up, select "I have a code I received from a friend":</li>
  <img src="http://imgur.com/sOTH7.png" alt="Screenshot">

<li> Enter one of the codes listed below: </li>

 <img src="http://imgur.com/jIToM.png" alt="Screenshot">

<li>After you've connected, click the "Select all" button in the bottom right, you'll now connect to everyone.</li>

    <dd>- If you miss this, click the "Add Friends" button, and select the last option. If the last option is greyed out, you're currently connected to everyone that's online.</dd>

<li>You may want to choose to click the "Do not show this message again" on the first popup, then click "yes"</li>

<li>Once in click the blue circling arrows in the bottom right if your files don't automatically begin to hash.</li>

<li>Please leave the program running at all times, even if it's minimized in the background.</li>

<li>Issues/Feature Requests should be reported <a href="http://code.google.com/p/alliance-p2p/issues/entry">here</a>, connection issues should be reported below.</li>


<b>Thats it, you're connected! Tell your friends, and share what you download, the link to this post is: <a href="http://code.google.com/p/alliance-p2p/wiki/SBUAlliance">http://code.google.com/p/alliance-p2p/wiki/SBUAlliance</a></b>
